inn1.comm: In the channel outside off stump, Tharanga leans across and shoulders arms. Typical start from Pollock
full and straight, on the leg and middle, Tharanga wrists it away to fine-leg. A misfield by Ntini and they will get two
The first play and miss of the day. In the temptation zone outside off and Tharanga pushes inside the line. Not much movement, enough to cause to trouble.
The first swing and miss. Similar line, a touch wider and Tharanga freed his arms but couldn't connect
homing in on the off stump line, Tharanga leans forward to push it to the off side
full and wide, driven to cover where de Villiers makes a half-stop.
tip and run. On the middle and leg, worked towards mid-on and they rush across for a single.
Short of length, outside off stump, Jayasuriya went for a cut but went too hard at it and the ball rolled towards cover.
beaten Full in length and it veers away with the usual Ntini angle and Jayasuriya pushes at it tentatively.

Almost a run out. Jayasuriya is itching to get off the mark and sets off after pushing to cover. Tharanga is not in a suicidal mood and sends him back. de Villiers swoops in and under-arms a direct hit but Jayasuriya scampers home in time. it was refered to third umpire.
beaten again. Ntini continues to curve it away from the left-hander who has a lame poke at it.
lands outside leg stump, on a length, comes in on the middle stump line, turned to the on side
first four of the day comes up via a fluent on drive. Full in length, on the middle and leg stump line and Tharanga eases forward and drives on the up, through the line, past mid-on
on the middle stump line, defended on the front foot
short and a touch wide outside off stump and Tharanga punches it through point. Pollock had a miserable day against Australia the other day and has not got to a great start here.
slower one, fullish, on the middle stump line and Tharanga leans forward to defend
slipping on to the pads as the ball straightened after landing around leg and middle stump line and they will get a run from a push to the on side
Full in length, around off stump, he has a stab at it, gets a inside-edge on to the pad

Ntini nails Tharanga with one of his specials : a length-delivery that angles away from the left-hand batsman. Tharanga pushes at it, bat away from the body, and edges it low to Kemp at first slip who pouches it safely.
lands outside off stump, on a length, and doesn't come back in much, left alone.
fuller, lands outside off stump and comes back in, Mahela lets that one go through as well.

beaten. From wide of the crease came a delivery that slanted in from outside off. After leaving two deliveries, Mahela stabs at this one and is beaten. Ntini does this quite often. He would jag a couple of deliveries back and then would bring in a couple but by not so much. The batsmen think it's going to cut back in, play at it but end up pushing inside the line
Full-pitched, on the off and middle, driven straight down the ground. A pile of saw dust, down the ground, acts a speed breaker and they will get only two.
Full, wide and Jayasuriya breaks free with a slash over cover. de Villiers tries his best - puts in a dive but can't prevent
leans forward to defend a length-delivery
That was fiercely thrashed away. Pollock continues to bleed. Back of length and outside off, enough for Jayasuriya to thrust his right foot out and crash it through the line, through extra cover.
fuller and straighter, Jaysuriya arrests his front foot movement, gets his bat around his front pad and flicks it past square-leg
lands on a length, on the stumps, turned away to the on side for a single
fullish, on the off and middle stump line, worked to midwicket
lands outside legstump, full in length, moves in towards leg and middle, Jayasuriya gets behind the line, nudges it to the on side
similar delivery but Jayasuriya innovates this time. He plays a cute pick-up stroke and ends up chipping it over midwicket. A shot powered by that bottom-hand of his.
from wide of the crease, a delivery in the channel outside off, Mahela covers his off stump and lets it go through to Boucher
climbs up from short of length, at the body, Mahela takes out the bottom-hand out of the handle and jabs it away to backward short leg region
on  the middle stump line, turned straight to square-leg. Mahela doesn't look too happy with his stroke. He could have wristed it past that fielder.
full and outside off, left alone
Fetch that! Pollock is getting hammered. Full in length and outside off, Jayasuriya leans forward and murders it on the up, over the bowler's head. Again that bottom-hand.
on the off stump line, shovelled past midwicket
Another swing, another boundary. Full in length, outside the off stump but Jayasuriya whacks it past mid-on.
off cutter, on the middle and legstump line, worked to midwicket
banged in short and it sails harmlessly outside off stump, Jayasuriya drops his wrists and watches it go by
slower one, on the off stump line, pushed to Gibbs at backward point
fullish, outside off, driven powerfully but straight to cover
full-pitched ouside off, run down to third man
around the off stump line, full in length, pushed to cover
back in length, around off stump line, Jayasuriya goes back and defends
beaten. Lands on a length, on the leg stump line and angles away. Jayasuriya shuffles across and nibbles at it
hops sideways, gets behind the line of a length-delivery and defends
full and around off stump, pushed to cover
back of length, on the off and middle stump line and Jayawardene wrists it away past square-leg.
in the channel outside off stump, left alone
lands outside off, straightens, Mahela pushes it , bat away from the body, to third man
full and swinging, late in the air and Jayasuriya goes for a typically lusty swing across the line but is beaten by that lateswing. Gets a inside-edge which takes the ball to square-leg
In the zone outside off stump and Mahela is sucked into a forward prod and is beaten as the ball straightens
short in length, around off stump, Jayasuriya hops up, pushes it to point
ouch. banged in short of lenght, around leg stump and it rears up at the ribs, Jayasuriya takes the bottom-hand out of the handle, fends it to the leg side
comes in from outside off stump, defended away
fuller as Ntini keeps changing the length, on the off and middle stump line, driven to mid-on
lands outside off stump, on a length, turned to short midwicket
on the middle stump line, worked to square-leg

Got 'em. First ball of the over, wide of the stumps, good bounce and Jayasuriya lashes fiercely. He can't get the timing right and the ball flies off a thickish edge to Kallis at point, standing at the edge of the circle. Good bowling from Langeveldt after Pollock's poor spell. This is a huge wicket for South Africa
slightly short, good healthy bounce and Sangakkara on the back foot defending it solidly
Full ball outside off, Sangakkara on the front foot and drives to extra cover.
Full ball on middle, swinging in. Langeveldt probing here. Sangakkara drives and scampers a quick single to mid-off
Full ball outside off, punched to mid-off

Shimmies down the track, gives himself some room and crashes it over the covers for a four. It was a short of a length delivery but he came down and met it on the half-volley. Clean strike from Jayawardene.
Ntini angling it away from the left-hander from over the wicket. Pitches on off and seams away alarmingly. Sangakkara can't reach it. Could have been a wide but umpire Harper decides against it

That's quite unplayable. Similar angle from Ntini, pitched on off and moves away beautifully. Sangakkara pushes his bat defensively but is beaten all ends up. That could have easily been edged to the eager slip cordon
Slightly wide of off, left alone this time
Straighter ball, turned away to midwicket for a quick single
Straight and back of a length, cutting in. Jayawardene pats it to the on side but can't risk the single
Full ball outside off, driven crisply to extra cover. No run again
Play and a miss. Sanga flashes at a length-delivery outside off and is beaten
similar line but Sanga is more cautious this time and lets it go through to the 'keeper
short in length, around off stump, Sangakkara goes back, punches it to mid-off
full, straight, skids on to the batsman who defends.
fuller, outside off and square-driven straight to point where Gibbs misfields. Ah! That's a surprise.
strangling line around off stump, Mahela dabs it to the off side
clipped off the hips, past square-leg for couple of runs.
full and outside off, left alone
around off stump, again angling away, Sangakkara opens the bat-face, steers to point
nonchalantly pulled. Easy on the eye. Short in length, on the middle stump line and Sangakkara eased back to pull it behind square-leg
And again. This time through the midwicket gap. Again short, but this one was outside off stump and Sangakkara pierces the midwicket gap.
full in length, around off stump, pushed to the off side
full in length, on the middle and leg stump line, Mahela wrists it to backward square-leg region and runs hard to come back for two
Charge and a miss. Mahela rushes down the track and has a swing at a length-delivery outside off.
lands on a length, outside off stump, straightens, Mahela leans across, towards the line and pushes it to cover
fuller, hint of outswing, Mahela drives, covers for the swing, and drives back down the track

gotcha! Done in by that away movement. Full in length, on the middle and leg stump line, Mahela shapes to wrist it away to the on side, the ball straightens and  takes the leading edge and pops up for de Villiers to hold a dolly at cover. South Africa are slowly taking control.
beaten Peach of a delivery.  Langeveldt continues to trouble the batsmen by making the ball hold its line. Chamara Silva pushes at a length-delivery around off stump and is beaten.
further away from the off stump and left alone.
Hall is greeted with a crisp cover drive but it's hit straight to cover. Hall, like Langeveldt, is a skiddy sort of a bowler.
drifting on to the legs and flicked away to fine leg where Pollock moves to his right to make a tumbling stop
short in length, on the middle and leg stump line, worked to the on side.
full and outside off stump, straightens after landing, Silva pushes at it, bat away from the body, and runs it down to third man
full in length, around off stump, Sanga leans forward to defend
slips on to the legs, flicked away past square-leg
well outside off, left alone.
And again. It moves away after landing well outside off, left alone again.
on the off stump line, goes on straight, pushed to cover point
lands on a length, around off stump, straightens, nudged to the off side and they rush across for a quick single.
fuller, again that straightening, on the middle stump line, driven to mid-on. Langeveldt has been quite impressive here. Right areas, slightly movement and he has the batsmen in a cautious mood.
length-delivery, around off stump, punched on the up to mid-off
full in length, on the middle and leg stump line, dabbed close on the on side .
shout for lbw. Full-pitched delivery that landed outside leg stump and moved in towards the leg peg and evades an intended drive and thuds into the pad.
on the middle stump line, driven to the off side
slower one, on the middle stump line, Sanga leans forward, pushes it slowly towards mid-off where Smith is standing deep and picks up a single
drifts on to the legs, a disgusted grunt from Hall, Silva tries to work it to on side, misses and the ball runs off the pad.
fuller and outside off, inviting a drive and Sanga obliges. It runs, off a thickish outside edge, down to third man
First four in over four overs. Short and outside off, Sanga eases back and across and cuts it past point.

fullish, on the legs, Sangakkara flicks, in the air, past square-leg. Langeveldt, who has been pretty impressive with his line and lenght, has erred on two occasions and has conceded boundaries both times. Since he doesn't have much pace, he has to be really careful with his radar.
gets it right this time, in the channel outside off and left alone
on the off stump, from a length, pushed towards mid-off
length-delivery on the off stump line, Sangakkara pushes it back down the track.
back of length, lands outside off stump, skids on to Silva who opens the bat-face, steers it to point.
fuller , outside off, Silva lunges at it, gets a outside edge and it runs to gully
full and straight, not much room to work with and Silva is contend pushing it to cover region
full and outside off stump line, guided to point
again that nagging line outside off stump, Silva stretches forward, pushes it to point. Wonder how long he will be patient.
there he goes. Short and wide and Silva frees his arms but can't reach it. The last ball of the Powerplay coming up

full, straight, on the off stump line, Silva lunges forward in defense - he has a habit of playing well in front of the body while defending- gets a outside edge which takes the ball down to third man
Slashed away. Kallis start off with a gentle loosener, well outside off and Silva, who has four half-centuries on a row, leans across and slashes it to deep point
overpitched outside off stump, driven powerfully but straight to cover.
Full and outside off stump, a tad slower in the air,  left alone

de Villiers misses a run out chance. Silva drove a fullish one to the left of de Villiers at cover and set off. Sanga sent him back and he was stranded but de Villiers, who had all the time in the world to take aim, missed.
leans forward to defend a length-delivery on the off stump line
half-volley outside off stump, Sangakkara drives straight to cover. An opportunity missed there. May be he went a touch hard at it.
full in length, moving away from off stump line, driven to extra cover where de Villiers moves across to make a neat diving stop

Sangakkara walks. It was banged in short and just outside leg stump, Sangakkara shaped to pull but the ball moved in a touch and cramped him up. The ball brushed the right glove and Boucher dived to his right to take it. The pair of Silva and Dilshan that took Sri Lanka out of trouble in the game against India will be on.

huge nip-backer. Landed on a length, well outside off stump and jagged back in. Silva stabs at it and the ball thuds into the inner thigh in front of off stump. There is a shout for lbw but umpire Harper doesn't agree. Hawk eye suggests it would have taken out middle.
Poor follow-up delivery. Slips it down the leg side
And again. He is dipping the ball back in but is starting from the middle. Needs to get it outside off.
starts from outside off, full in length and it curves in towards middle and off, defended on the front foot
full and in the zone outside off stump, Dilshan gets into a perfect position and shoulders arms
beaten by the lack of bounce. Landed outside off stump,moved in a touch and a kept a touch low. Dilshan shapes to cut but is beaten by the lack of bounce.
short at the body, pulled away to long leg

huge huge shout for a catch behind but umpire Bucknor remains impassive. Fullish, outside off stump and it holds its line. Dilshan pushes inside the line and is beaten. There seemed to be a daylight between bat and ball. Replays don't reveal any edge.
overpitched outside off, driven straight to mid-off.
full in length, comes back in from outside off stump, pushed to the off side
again drifts in after landing, turned close on the leg side and they run a quick single. Hall is getting the ball to curve in.
Full and outside off stump, played to cover
banged in short, Dilshan pulls but it's a unconvincing shot. A feeble pull as he is hurried by the pace. The ball bobs over the square-leg region much to the dismay of Hall.
slower off cutter, outside off and Dilshan is too early into his drive and the ball rolls towards mid-off

Gibbs does a Jonty! Remember that Inzamam-ul-Haq run out in 1992? Silva pushes a length-delivery on the off side,close on the off side and wants a run. Dilshan doesn't agree with that assessment and sends him back. Too late. Gibbs charges in, picks the ball and flies into the furniture. Gone! A YouTube moment.
fullish, outside off stump, driven to mid-off
in the channel outside off, slanting away, left alone
streaky edge, down to third man. Full in length, and outside off stump, Arnold tries to square-drive but is beaten by the extra bounce.
length-delivery on the off stump line, pushed to point
full in length, outside off stump, square-driven to point
Full in length, on the off stump line, driven inside-out to cover
length-delivery on the off stump line, jabbed away with bit of inside-edge

Fuller, on the off stump line, Arnold stabs at it, gets a inside-edge down to fine leg. 100 is up. But half the side gone. South Africa are climbing all over Sri Lanka. Can Dilshan and Arnold lift the side out of the ditch?
around the off stump line, pushed to point
lands on the off stump line, moves in a touch, worked to right of mid-on
full, wide outside off stump and Arnold has a wild swing at it but can't connect.
Hello? where did that one come from. Full-pitched outside off and Dilshan leans forward and drives inside-out through extra cover. Fab shot.
In the channel outside off stump, Dilshan doesn't like the programming and lets it go through to Boucher
on the middle stump line, shovelled away past midwicket.
on the middle and leg stump line, worked past midwicket
on the middle and leg stump line, defended to the on side.
full-pitched outside off stump, pushed to cover point, Dilshan wants a run, Arnold is not interested and Prince fires in a throw, misses and gives away a over throw
on the off stump line, pushed to the off side
Tucked away to the leg side. They think of a single but decline against it
Back of a length, outside off, Arnold drives but it's straight to cover
Full ball outside off, better line from Pollock, Arnold drives but gets a thick inside edge to mid-on

Similar delivery, not as full but probing on and outside off. Arnold tucks it to the on side. Just one run off the over. Good return for Pollock, after a poor opening spell. Sanath Jayasuriya had taken 21 off 12 deliveries that time
Full and outside off, Dilshan goes for his typical slash. Can't get the timing and it's straight to point
Straight and full. Dilshan pushes it back to the bowler cautiously
short and on off, Dilshan goes for the pull but can't get the timing again. No run as mid-on cleans up
digs it in short. Dilshan goes for the pull but takes his eyes off in the last moment. Top edge flies to the vacant short fine-leg region. That could have been dangerous
Straight and drifting down the pads, Arnold whips it away to the leg side and they complete a couple
driven to mid-off for. Good timing, not much placement.
Good delivery on middle and cutting back in, tucked away to the leg side

Full ball on off. Driven to mid-off. Much better spell from Pollock, the sort we've been accustomed to over the years. The last game was a nightmare for him, where he conceded his most expensive one-day figures, and this didn't start too promisingly.
Mistimed pull to backward square leg
Pitched on middle and angling in, tapped to the leg side

Teasing line again, DIlshan can only go on the backfoot and defend. Good decision by Smith to bring back Pollock at this stage. The pressure is on and it provides Pollock a chance to regain his rhythm.

Offcutter cut straight to point. Good spell of bowling from South Africa. Last ten overs have produced just 28. Nothing much wrong with the pitch, the centre of attention before the match. It's slightly on the slow side with some spongy bounce but no major demons there. Time for drinks
lands outside off stump, goes on straight, punched to cover
lands outside off, turns in, nudged to the on side
beaten in the flight. Full and Arnold shapes to drive but is beaten by the turn and the ball thuds into the pad
slips down the leg side
floated on the off stump line, not much turn, defended on the front foot
low full-toss, driven to long on
lands outside leg stump line, turns, Dilshan leans forward, opens the bat-face and guides it to point
full, outside off stump, Dilshan waits, wrists it through point
off cutter, around off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
on the middle and leg stump line, turned to the midwicket gap
shout for lbw. Slow off cutter on the off stump line, Dilshan shuffles across, gets outside off stump and tries to work it to on side. The point of impact was just outside off. Only just.
similar line, Dilshan is careful not to go square and drives in the V, to mid-on
full, straight, on the middle stump line, Dilshan stays adjacent to the line, drives inside-out to left of mid-off
floated outside off, driven powerfully to long on

drifting in from outside off stump, Dilshan pads it away and there is a huge shout from Boucher and even bigger one from Peterson who bowled that from round the stumps. Camera pans to Bucknor. Impassive. Statue. And slowly he opens his mouth and shouts, NOT OUT. The ball was turning and would have missed off stump
fullish, on the middle stump line and again Dilshan drives inside-out to long off
lands outside off, comes in defended away
slightly short, on the stumps, driven down the ground
outside off stump, dabbed away to third man
slow off cutter, on the leg stump line, nudged to midwicket
full in length, around off stump, this is a slow wicket, the ball rarely hurries on to the bat and Dilshan has enough time to force it through the off side ring
on the off and middle stump line, moves in a touch, worked to midwicket

full and straight, on the off stump line, Dilshan wrists it away behind point. He stays adjacent to the line usually, doesn't get behind it and that gives him room to square-drive or punch deliveries on the off and sometimes even on off and middle.
short in length, outside off stump, Arnold cuts it past point
slow through the air, drifting in from round the stumps, Dilshan is down the ground and drives to long-off
on the off stump line, slight turn, worked to the on side
similar delivery but this time Arnold chooses to sweep.
flat, on the off stump line, slight turn and Dilshan rocks back, makes room and cuts it to sweeper cover
short in length, flat, on the middle stump line, driven to long-on.
defended on the front foot
flighted delivery, swept to long leg
low full-toss and Dilshan swings it over midwicket. Clean strike.
tossed-up, driven to extra cover

sharp turn there. Muralitharan would be looking at that closely. Landed outside off stump, Dilshan backed away to cut but is surprised as the ball breaks in sharply and he adjusts it by stabbing it away
on the middle stump line, flicked away through square-leg
from round the stumps, an arm-ball, on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
on the middle and off stump line, full in length, Arnold leans forward, whips it through square-leg
floats in arm-ball, Dilshan comes down the track, drives but straight to cover
will retain the strike with a drive to long on
short in length, outside the off stump, not much turn and Dilshan backs to cut it to sweeper cover to bring up the fifty partnership.
on the off stump line, driven to cover
outside off stump, Arnold nudges it to short third man
lands on the off stump, spins down leg side, turned to short fine leg
Similar delivery and the same shot. No run.
comes down the track, reaches the pitch and drives to long on
driven to long off
on the off and middle stump line, nudged to the on side
Arnold sweeps. In front of square. Floated on the off stump line and down he went on the knee to sweep it. Arnold's first boundary.
on the middle stump line, turns in, tucked behind square for a quick single
short, just outside leg stump, Dilshan backs away and cuts to deep point. He could have pulled it but he chose to cut with the spin
on the stumps, turned to midwicket
again short and again Dilshan backs away to cut past point.
fuller, outside off stump, driven to cover
flighted outside off, Arnold stretches across, drives to deep cover
on the middle stump line, turns in slightly, flicked past square-leg
slightly short in length, turns in from the off stump line, driven to long on
a low full-toss, whipped to deep midwicket. He could have utilised it better. Smith will be thinking about bringing his pacemen. They are milking the spinners.
banged in short, outside off stump, Arnold pulls it to midwicket
full in length, on the off stump line, driven to mid-off
length-delivery, well outside off stump, Arnold wants to force it through the off side region, but is beaten by the change in pace and ends up mis-timing the stroke.
short and rising, pulled from outside off, to right of deep midwicket where Peterson fumbles
fuller, wider, outside off and creamed to widish long off

full in length, on the middle and off stump line, Arnold leans forward, tries to drive, gets an inside-edge on to the pad and the ball rolls away to the off side. Arnold wants a run, Dilshan doesn't share the enthusiasm
drifting on the pad, Dilshan takes out his left leg from the line, works it through square-leg region
full and on the middle and leg, driven to mid-on
full and outside off, Dilshan tries to drill it through cover, misses.

Steve Bucknor does a nice little jig to get away from a fierce pull. The ball dipped in dangerously at him, he hopped up and spread his legs - don't let your imagination run wild!,  and the ball went through his legs. It was short in lengthdelivery  and Dilshan pulled it straight to Bucknor
on the off stump line, driven to cover
length-delivery that straightened after landing outside off stump, skids on and Dilshan shapes to play a rather expansive drive over cover but doesn't make contact.
slower one, on the middle stump line, Dilshan spots it, works it to Pollock at deep backward square-leg. They look for two but Pollock fires in a flat throw and they settle for one
on the off stump line, a length-delivery, square-driven on the up, through backward point
overpitched outside off, driven down the ground to long off
on the off stump line, dabbed to third man
Half-volley outside off, Dilshan drills it through extra cover. Whack.
slightly short in length, outside off stump, cut to Gibbs at point
on the hips, tucked down to fine leg
another skidder that comes in and Dilshan is beaten on the cut. Landed outside off stump, skidded in and cramped up Dilshan.
slower one, on the legs, nudged to fine leg. Dilshan moves to 49
another slower one, full and on the middle, driven to mid-off where Pollock fields and has a shy at the non-striker's end, misses but Arnold was in.
slashed away to third man and that's his fifty. Partnership moves to 84 as Sri Lanka continue to fightback. This is his first fifty in a World Cup game.
short in length, on the middle stump line and Dilshan pulls it to deep midwicket. Hall moves to his left to make the stop.
slower one, on the off stump line, dabbed to Gibbs at backward point. Dilshan is sent back by Arnold. Wise decision.
short, Dilshan pulls but is beaten by the lack of bounce and also, he is a touch too early into the stroke. The ball thuds into the mid-riff and rolls away
change of pace. On the middle, squirted to midwicket
Dilshan continues to pull away. Again short and he pulled it over midwicket and gets a four
The routine continues. One short followed by slower one. On the off stump line, pushed to Gibbs
short in length, outside off stump, it stops on Dilshan who was looking to thrash it through the off side but ends up sending it to cover.
fuller, outside off, driven to deep cover

Super strike! It was full in length, on the legs, and Arnold lapped it around the corner. Innovative strike. He just leant forward and wristed it away. This is the highest partnership for SL for the 6th wicket
low full-toss, on the legs, flicked straight to short fine leg. Missed out there.

Dilshan falls. Slashed away to third man. What a fiesty knock it has been though. Full in length, outside off stump, Dilshan freed his arms at the width and  ended up slicing it away to Kemp at third man.
fullish, on the middle stump line, driven to long on
slow off cutter, around off stump, pushed to backward point
banged in short, outside off stump, cut to the sweeper cover
fullish, outside off, driven to long off
on the middle and leg stump line, dabbed to the off side.
short of length, on the middle stump line, driven on the up to mid-off and 200 is up. A pretty good fightback from SL.
slow off cutter, full in length, Arnold pushes it into the cover region to retain the strike. Three overs to go.
on the off stump line, another slower one, guided to cover point. Both Hall and Langeveldt use off cutters as their slower ones.
Maharoof backed away, Hall pushed it wider outside off and Maharoof reaches it, drives but makes contact with the bottom half of the bat and the ball rolls towards cover
low full-toss, cross batted away to left of Ntini at deep midwicket
another low full-toss, outside off stump, driven to mid-on.
fullish, on the legs, Arnold leans forward, wrists it behind square-leg. Very well placed.
fifty up for Arnold. Immensely valuable knock. Fullish, outside off and cut down to third man
Swing and a miss. Arnold tries to slog a fullish delivery outside off, misses.
Ah! Arnold falls. Full-pitched on the middle stump, Arnold goes down on a bent knee and attempts a slog across the line. He gets a top-edge which is snaffled up by Boucher.
yorker-length, on the middle, dug out to cover
lands outside off stump, skids in and Maharoof has one almight swing across the line, misses and the ball bounces over the off stump

Another one goes, going for some quick runs. Maharoof lofted a full-length delivery high over extra cover. Three men converged on it. Ntini from deep cover, Smith running back from cover and Gibbs rushing across from long off. Finally it was Ntini who took it.

Langeveldt grabs a five-for. Three of them came in the over and would you believe it, it's a maiden to boot. What a over at the death.  Again full in length, Vaas has a swing but sends it down the throat of Gibbs at long-on.
pinched a single with a drive to cover
Malinga rushes out, backs to the leg side in the process and Hall pushed that one well outside off and the slinger couldn't reach it
Pollock runs out Murali. The innings has folded up. Malinga pushed a fullish delivery to backward point where Pollock swooped on the ball, took aim and fired in a fatal direct hit.

inn2.comm: lands outside off stump, on a length, moves away, Smith dabs it down to third man
full and swinging in. On the middle stump line. de Villiers leans forward and defends.
Again that disconcerting inswing. Bends back in from the off stump, de Villiers plays it with a straight bat
And again. This time the bat came down in an angle but he manages to stab it away. de Villiers has an interesting technique. He presses his left foot forward and that foot faces mid-off. Hmm..
Shout for lbw as the ball curves back in. Landed on the middle and leg, bends in and de Villiers is struck on the front pad as he presses forward in defense. Perhaps, it was going down leg side

beauty! de Villiers is cleaned up. Landed on a length, around off and middle and bend back like a banana. de Villiers pushes outside the line and the middle stump is pegged back. Death rattle. What a start for Sri Lanka.
yorker-length to start with. Slings one full, on the off stump line, jabbed away
drifting on to the legs and that's Smith scoring area. He leans forward, whips it through square-leg
full, straight, on the middle stump line, bat comes dangerously outside the line but he makes contact and the ball rolls to mid-on
on the off stump line, Smith doesn't move his feet, just pushes it to cover
short in length, around off stump, mistimes a drive to cover
lands back of length, on the middle stump line, hurries on and Smith doubles up as the ball thuds in to the thigh pad.
ooh.... another one that curves back in but it starts from outside off and Kallis shoulders arms. The ball came back in and went past the off stump.
on the off stump line, coming in, Kallis dabs it away to third man
length-delivery around off stump, driven to mid-off
homing in on the off stump, again a touch of movement away, defended. He is yet to slip one with the angle. All his deliveries have curved in to the RHB
around off stump, nudged to point
slips in on to the pad, flicked away to fine leg
wide down the leg side. Lost control in the action there. The right shoulder came across a bit too much
full and slanting away from Smith who has a flash at it, misses and is beaten.
Another Malinga delivery on the legs, another flicked-four from Smith.
Another one. On the hips, Smith stays back and clips it past the diving square-leg fielder.
on the off and middle, worked to midwicket
short of lenght, outside off stump, Kallis pushes at it, bat away from the body, steers it to third man
full in length, outside off stump, Smith drives but doesn't connect.
full in length, on the off stump and Smith shows he can straight down the grouind as well. Hits it on the up, past mid-off.
Vaas continues to harass the batsmen with his late inswing. Full in length, lands outside off stump and curves in, Kallis jabs at it, gets a inside-edge, on to the leg side
again inswing, fuller and outside off stump, driven to cover
Classy off drive. Full in length, just outside off stump and comes back in a touch , Kallis leans forward, drives to left of mid-off.
Kallis skips a few steps down the track to counter the swing and drives a fullish delivery down the ground. He didn't charge out, just walked down the track.
Again a bit of walk down the track. Vaas drags back the length and raps him on the pad with a delvery coming in.

almost traps him in front. Another length-delivery, on the off and middle, bends in, Kallis is almost caught at his crease, somehow manages to bring his bat down and jabs it away. Inside-edge takes the ball to the on side
full in length, on the middle stump line, driven to mid-on
dropped by Mahela. A very tough chance at first slip. Kallis flashed at a length-delivery outside off stump and it flew to the right of Mahela who dived full-length but couldn't hold on to it.
slower one, on the middle stump line, turned to midwicket. Both batsmen wanted a run initially and then retreat
on the middle and leg, worked straight to short fine leg.
short of length, on the middle and leg, clipped away through square-leg
slightly outside off stump, again moves away from Smith who pushes it to third man

Back of length, comes in from outside off stump, Kallis square-drives it past point. Vaas has repeatedly brought the ball back in to RHB. Not a single delivery, if my memory serves me right, has gone with the angle.
Smith backs away and frees his arms. Misses and Sanga whips the bails off in a blink. Appeals for a stumping but Smith had planted his back foot inside the crease.
on the off stump line, pushed to the off side
on the middle stump, full in length, curves away a touch, flicked straight to square-leg
on the off stump line, jumps up a touch, Kallis adjusts by taking the bottom-hand out of the handle, pushes it out to the off side
almost caught by Chamara Silva at cover. Just short of him. Kallis square-drove a full-length delivery uppishly and Silva threw himself forward and to his left but couldn't reach it. Valiant effort.
cut and a miss. Short in length and Kallis eased back to cut but.... Smith goes down the track to have a chat with Kallis.
Overpitched on the middle stump line and Kallis smashes it down the ground. Classy. He made effort to direct it between the bowler and mid-on.
full and outside off, driven to left of mid-off where Murali dives to make the stop
on the middle stump line, shapes in, Kallis pushes at it, gets a inside-edge, on to pad and bobs in the air to right of short midwicket. But far away from him
Angles this one away. A rare move today. May be for the first time. Kallis lets that one go through to Sangakkara who is standing up to the stumps
outside off stump, run down to third man
on the off stump line, keeps a touch low - sign of things to come? - pushed back down the track
Smith backs away, Vaas follows him, driven inside-out to cover where Arnold makes a diving stop
on the legs, driven through midwicket
full in length, outside off stump and Kallis opts for a square drive. Very well placed. Through cover point.
outside off stump, Kallis shuffles across, a pre-meditated move, and places it to right of mid-on
full and outside off stump, driven to mid-off where Malinga fields and fires in a throw to nowhere. It goes down the middle of the track
on the off stump line, Kallis leans forward, guides to cover
Almost a run out. Again that shuffle across, and he places it to mid-on where Maling fires in a throw, misses and Kallis survives.
short in length, on the middle and leg stump line, pulled to deep square-leg
on the middle stump line, Smith shapes to play to the on side, the ball shapes away and gets a leading edge to cover. Again a bit of misunderstanding, Kallis wants a run but is sent back
Smith backs away, Vaas hurls in a yorker-length delivery, jabbed to mid-off
on the middle and leg, worked to midwicket
Again he backs away and drives a low dipping full-toss, on the middle stump, to Murali at mid-off
outside off stump, full in length, square-driven to widish third man
Just over short midwicket. Smith backs away, again, and muscles a length-delivery on the middle stump across the line.
Fullish, outside off stump, driven to point.
Fullish, driven to mid-on
on the middle stump line, pushed towards mid-on and they take another risky single
Slower one, full and on the middle and leg line, Smith spotted it, waited and swung it over midwicket
short in length, on the middle and leg stump line, worked through square-leg
outside off stump, run down to third man
lands on a length, around off stump, straightens, dabbed to wide third man
Smith backs away, Vaas follows him, driven to mid-off
Backs away a touch, then gets back to the original position, and drives to mid-on
The first six of the match and hence first six on this new ground. Again he backs away and wallops a fullish delivery over long off. Boom!
on the off and middle stump line, turned to midwicket.
on the middle stump line, worked behind square-leg
Full ball on the stumps, half-volley almost, Smith steers it straight to the square fielder.
Back of a length outside off, glided wide of third man and scamper for a couple. This pair showing a lot of urgency
Clipped off his pads, to the right of fine leg, they complete another two. This is turning out to be too easy. Apart from Vaas, none of the other faster men seem have made an impression
Back cut to third man for a single
Defended solidly off the front foot. Back of a length outside off and Kallis meets it confidently

Punished fiercely through the covers. It's a good length delivery outside off and Kallis simply stands and delivers. Clean swing of the bat and finds the gap on the off. Ball screams away to the boundary
Straight and keeps slightly low. It's a slingy action and doesn't bounce too much. Smith comes down on it at the last moment.
Back of a length, Smith stands and smashes it past the bower for a blistering four. They're no-one in the boundary and Smith brings up his fifty in style.

Another whip off his pads. Smith going great guns now. Full length delivery on the pads and Smith gets onto the front foot and clips it crisply in front of square for another four. South Africa motoring here.
Yorker length delivery and Smith drives through the line. Can't get the timing and it trickles down the ground
On the back foot and cutting back behind square for a single
Thick edge to third man for a couple. Good bit of fielding at the third man fence.
Oh gosh! Ripping offspinner and the ball keeps low. Almost zoots through, past Smith, past Sangakkara for two byes. What a start!
Doosra this time. Smith gets forward and is rapped on the pads. Huge appeal but he was hit slightly outside the line. Bucknor declines the appeal
Tucked away to the leg sid eand scamper two
Turn and bounce. Starting on middle and spinning away. Smith sweeps but misses. Dangerous sweeping Murali on such a surface
Forward defence to cover
On the front foot and whipped away against the spin for a single. Lots of drama in that over. Spin, and how South Africa play it, could well decide this one
tossed up outside off, driven to long off
from round the stumps, a fullish delivery, driven to long on
lands outside off stump, Smith leans forward and defends
on the off stump line, Smith comes down the track, flicks to squareleg
on the off and middle, driven to midwicket
slow through the air, on the off and middle, again whipped to midwicket

Murali gets his man. Lovely bit of cricket. Flighted delivery, on a length, outside off stump and Smith is sucked into a drive. He is beaten in the flight and then by the turn and Sangakkara whips the bails off in a flash. Smith was dragged out of the crease. And it was some philosphical reaction from Murali. As if he expected it. No pumping of the fist, no big celebration, he just walks towards his team-mates with a smile. The smiling assassin.
A doosra. Landed outside off stump, Gibbs shuffles across and is beaten by it
on the middle stump, spins, turned to the on side with the turn
Another lovely doosra and Kallis is beaten. He is bowling from round the stumps and Kallis is attracted into a loose drive. Sanga takes out the bails but Kallis had not dragged his foot out
on the middle stump line, worked to the on side
from round the stumps, a fullish delivery outside leg stump, pushed away to the on side.
floated in, slow through the air, on the middle and off stump line, defended down the track
slow through the air, a gentle flaoater,  Gibbs reaches out, is beaten in the flight as he shapes to drive but adjusts by taking the bottom-hand out and pushes it down the track
driven to extra cover
on the middle and leg, driven to deep midwicket for a single.
low full-toss, whipped to deep midwicket
from round the stumps arrives a flighted delivery on the off stump line, square-driven past point
tossed up, outside off stump, pushed to cover point for a single. Arnold's throw hits Kallis on the back and he immediately apolgises. Thankfully, it was not a flat and a fast throw.
shuffles back, works a length-delivery to midwicket
on the middle stump line, turns in and raps Gibbs on the pad
flatter, on the middle stump line, Gibbs leans forward, wrists it to short fine leg
greets him with a neat off drive through widish mid-off region.
full, straight, on the off and middle, pushed through cover.
fullpitched outside off stump, Gibbs drives but is too early into the stroke and gets a inside-edge to the leg side
fullish, outside off stump, driven back to the bowler
Attempted yorker, ends up as a low full-toss on the off stump line and Gibbs leans forward and whips it past mid-on. Super shot.
short of length, outside off stump, pushed to cover point
On the off stump line, worked to deep midwicket
doosra , a touch short in length, pushed to cover region
. flatter and on the off and middle, worked to midwicket
another ripping doosra and Gibbs is beaten. On the off stump line and it moves away, Gibbs pokes at it.
full, outside off stump, Gibbs lunges at it, the ball dips, and turns away and flies between Mahela and Sangakkara.
arm-ball from round the stumps, drifts on to the pad and raps him on the front leg
on the middle and leg stump line, driven to long on
on the middle stump line, Kallis leans forward, opens the bat-face and square-drives it through cover point
on the middle stump line, Gibbs drives to widish long on
floated in on the middle stump, driven to long on
from over the wickets this time, flighted delivery on the middle and leg stump line, slow through the air and Gibbs drives it back to the bowler
spins in from outside off stump, Kallis leans forward to defend.
fuller, outside off stump, Kallis drives down town to long on
well outside the off stump and Gibbs sweeps from there, past square-leg
spins in from outside off stump, Kallis goes back and whips it from the front of the stumps, past square-leg
turns in from outside off stump, works it to on side
doosra but short in length and Kallis picks it. Rocks back and punches it through cover. Lethal strike.
on the middle and leg, Gibbs goes back to work it to deep midwicket
on the middle and leg stump line, turns, Kallis guides it to point
slow through the air, on the middle and leg, worked to square-leg
on the leg stump line, turned to left of squareleg
The singles keep coming. Easy. Gibbs goes back to punch a slightly short of length delivery to long off
outside leg stump and swept away fine
on the middle stump line, turned to short backward square-leg
another single down to long on.
doosra that landed outside off stump, Gibbs picks it and covers for the break away and defends
low full toss, outside off, driven back to the right of the bowler who stops it with his boot
on the off stump line, Gibbs leans forward and smothers the turn.
Fullish, outside off, Kallis flashes, gets a outside edge, down to third man
on the middle stump line, worked to deep midwicket. Another easy single. SA are approaching it pretty clinically. No risks. Doing it in singles.
full in length, around off stump line, driven to mid-off. Easy on the eye. high left-elbow and all that jazz.
full and outside off stump, Kallis leans forward, opens the bat-face, runs it down to third man
full and wide outside off stump, Gibbs drives through cover
slightly short in length, outside off stump, pushed to cover point for a single.
on the off and middle, turned to right of Mahela at midwicket. Mahela fires in a throw to Dilshan who whips the bails off, appeals but Bucknor turns it down. Gibbs was well in.
on the middle and leg, lapped around the corner.
on the off stump line, turns in with a bit of bounce, jabbed away to the on side
on the middle stump line, dabbed away to the on side to bring up the fifty partnership.
Kallis gets another single - only two fours in the partnership- with a nudge to square-leg.
full in length, tails in a touch, defended on the front foot
slightly short in length, outside off stump, Kallis eases it down to third man
full-pitched outside off stump, creamed through extra  cover. 150 up. 60 runs to go for SA.
slower one, delivered from the back of the hand, on the off stump line, dabbed away to the off side
bit of width outside off stump and Gibbs drives on the up but straight to cover
fuller, on the off stump line, tails in, worked to midwicket
outside off stump, driven to extra cover
floated on the middle, turned to short fine leg
leans forward to defend
on the middle stump line, Gibbs works it with the turn, past square-leg
fuller, outside off stump, Kallis goes back and across and square-drives it to deep point
on the off stump line, turned to midwicket.
On the middle stump line, worked past midwicket.
flighted doosra on the middle stump line and Gibbs, against the run of play, opts for a slog-sweep, gets a inside-edge to square-leg.
on the middle stump line, turned past square-leg. Kallis is playing really well here. No risks.
leans forward to smother the spin
doosra outside the leg stump, slow through the air, Gibbs leans forward, waits and drives to long on
on the middle stump line, played with the turn to short fine leg
arm-ball, on the off stump line, short in length and swatted away to long off
slow through the air, on the middle stump line, kallis defends, gets a leading edge to cover
low full toss, driven to long on
floats one on the middle, defended on the front foot
tossed-up, on the middle peg, defended
flighted delivery on the middle and off, Gibbs backs away, drives inside out to sweeper cover

Murali winks out Gibbs. Another flighted delivery and Gibbs is down the track. The ball dips rapidly on Gibbs who drives uppishly, low and to the right of Murali who dives to take the catch. SA need only 50 while SL need 7 wickets.

Murali takes out Boucher. Two in two balls. Suddenly, SL are spinning back into the game. From round the stumps, it lands on the off and middle stump, quicker through the air, Boucher is caught at the crease and it spins in to catch him in front. The magician is unleashing his tricks.
huge appeal for a catch at short-leg. Fullish, on the leg stump line, it spins to evade the forward poke, thuds into the pad and flies straight to short-leg
outside off stump, pushed to backward point
flat, lands outside offstump, turns in, Kallis stabs at it, gets a inside-edge to short fine leg.
leans forward, turns a fullish delivery to midwicket.
down the leg side, Kallis attempts a sweep, misses and Sanga goes up in appeal. It brushed the pad but Bucknor signals it as a wide.
floated on the middle, driven straight back and it crashes into the sticks at the other end
arm-ball, outside off stump, keeps a touch low, whipped to midwicket
outside off stump, slashed away off a thickish outside edge, past short third man
beaten. Full in length, outside off and Kallis tries a square-drive and doesn't make contact.
slower through the air, on the middle and leg stump line, driven to long on. Drinks.
full in length, on the middle and leg stump, turned to midwicket. The ball tailed in late. Hint of reverse swing.
lands on the off stump, shapes in a touch and Kallis pushes it calmly through cover. Kemp to face Malinga.
Screaming yorker, 85.3 mph, on the middle stump line, swings in late and Kemp quickly takes out his left leg from the line and digs it out.
bouncer now and pulled away to long leg
short in length, curves in towards the off stump, Kallis takes out the bottom-hand from the handle, directs the ball to third man
full, straight, on the off and middle stump line, deflected to midwicket
lands on the off stump, turns away slightly, Kallis gets on to the front foot, waits and pushes it past point
drifts in on the middle, defended on the front foot
And again. Pushed to cover
lands on the off stump, turns away, Kemp looks surprised by the turn - Jayasuriya had been bowling a slew of arm-balls, adjusts to wrist it away to the off side
fuller and quicker, driven to long on
tossed-up, low dipping full-toss, driven to cover
yorker-length, on the off and middle stump line, reverses in, Kemp drives, gets an inside-edge, to fine leg
length-delivery on the middle stump line, tapped to the on side
fullish, hint of late swing, driven through mid-off
on the off stump line, on a length, nudged to point
yorker, slipping down the leg side, Kemp tries to get his bat down in a hurry, ball thuds into the boot and slips to the fine leg boundary.
drifting on the leg side, flicked away fine.
short in length, on the off stump, driven to deep cover
fuller and outside off, sliced away through backward point
on the middle stump line, driven back to the bowler

Sangakkara produces a smart stumping.  Arm-ball outside the off stump and Kemp pushes inside the line and is beaten. Sangakkara whips the bails off, Kemps tries to slide it in but the foot is in the air! He is gone!
dropped by Malinga Fullish, on the middle stump line  and Kallis drives,  uppishly, low to to the left of Malinga who bends low  but ends up palming it. Quite a tough chance. What a crucial let-off.
gets a single with a drive to deep cover
full in length, outside off stump, Pollock leans forward, drives to cover region.
full in length, on the middle stump line, drifts in late, Pollock plays in the V, drives to mid-on
yorker-length, on the middle and leg, Pollock doesn't get his left leg across, just leans over, digs it out to midwicket. Very well played.
tossed-up, outside off and driven to sweeper cover.
arm-ball , on middle and off, pushed to mid-off
similar delivery, pushed back to the bowler
threatens to charge out but pulls back his front leg, drives to long off
outside off stum and Kallis drives to long off and limps across.
slower through the air, on the off stump line, Pollock leans forward to defend
low dipping full-toss on the middle stump line, driven through the on side
Murali tosses it up outside off stump, driven to long-off.
Another single down to long on. Kallis stopped mid-track and then rushes along. Cramps.
lands on the off and middle and spins sharply down the leg side.
outside leg stump, a topspinner, nudged to short-leg
flatter, quicker, turns in sharply from outside off stump, Pollock pushes forward in defense and the ball goes off the pad to short leg
lands on the leg stump line, defended to short leg
leans forward to defend
will pick up a single with a drive to backward point
leans forward, pushes to cover
slow through air, on the off stump line, pushed to point
comes down the track, drives to long on
on the off stump line, full, Kallis leans forward and paddles it fine.
floated in on the middle, flicked to behind square-leg
quickish off spin ,from round the stumps, on the leg, Pollock pushes forward in defence, is rapped on the pads but it was going down leg side
short in length, backs away to cut it past point
slower through the air, on the middle and leg, Kallis is beaten in flight, the ball thuds into the pad and goes to short-leg. They appeal for a catch, turned down, rightly, by harper
fullish, on middle and leg, worked to long leg
That's the end of Murali. His last delivery landed on the middle stump line, turned in, nudged to the on side
full and outside off, guided to backward point
full, on the middle stump line, goes away with the angle, Kallis leans forward, drives through point
full in length, on the middle stump line, driven to mid-off
slower one, full and on the off stump line, Pollock drives over cover. SA need only 10.
yorker, ends up a low full-toss, driven to mid-off
low full-toss, swings away, pushed to cover
very full and straight, Malinga searching for the yorker, Pollock digs it out well, playing back down the pitch to the bowler
too full and on the pads, Pollock has no problems moving across his stumps and flicking that away through midwicket, that went sweetly off the bat and once it beat the infield was four all the way
once again yorker length, a slower ball though, Pollock gives himself room to hit but only manages to squirt the ball back down the pitch to the bowler
full and far outside the off, another shot flayed, the ball skews off the bottom edge down to third-man and a couple of more runs result

BINGO! Finally Malinga strikes, that is a superb bit of bowling. It's a slower ball on the stumps, Pollock just does not pick it, plays inside the line of the ball and loses his leg stump. Even with the game all but gone Sri Lanka are fighting. Pollock played a good hand but now he's gone!

ANOTHER! Andrew Hall goes off the very first ball! It's another speared-in yorker, Hall just about manages to dig it out, but he can't keep the ball down ... it bobs up into the air for the man at cover to pouch easily! Is there a twise left in this game
fullish and outside the off, driven inside out towards cover, closer to the target ...
very full, very straight, this one doesn't swing, it goes on with the arm, flick played and missed, rapped on the pad, loud shout for the lbw but that's clearly going down leg
full and on the off stump, driven positively to the off side with a straight bat
this one bends in sharply from outside the off, Peterson defends carefully with bat held close to pad

another top ball from Vaas. This is really tight stuff. The ball comes in sharply in the air from outside th eoff stump, Peterson defends with bat close to pad. There's a stifled shout for the lbw but it's turned down
another typically good Vaas ball, defended down to point, they won't  try for the single and this will leave Kallis on strike

Would you believe it? Malinga has got the hat-trick! Full, furious, outside off stump, Kallis goes for a square-drive and nicks it behind. Loud appeal. Kallis stays rooted. Even louder appeal and Harper raises the fatal finger. SA eight down and choking real badly.

And then they were one! Malinga gets four in four. Unbelievable! Screaming yorker and Ntini drives, plays all over it  and ball crashes into the middle stump. Malinga is slinging down magic deliveries and SA are nine down.
beaten Just kissed past the off stump. Tremendous nerves out there. Full  and just outside off, yorker-length, Langeveldt pokes at it and gets beaten
full, straight, on the off stump, pushed to mid-off. 3 to win from 20 balls. Camera pans to South Africa dressing room. They look stunned
Jayasuriya mis-fields at squareleg and SA sneak in one run. SLower one, on the middle and leg, turned to behind square. Jayasuriya moves to his right but misfields.
beauty, another delivery that teases the outside edge. Full and tailing away from off stump, drives and is beaten. What a fab over it has been.
fullish, just outside off stump, pushed to cover
beaten! Lands back of length, on the off stump line and shapes away, Langeveldt has a tentative poke - nervousness, can't blame him and is beaten
pushes it across Langeveldt who lets it go. He has taken the first three deliveries away. Will he bend the next one in?
off cutter, slanting away from the off stump, Langeveldt stretches forward, opens the bat-face, steers to point. Pure drama.
again another off cutter, around off stump, Langeveldt leans forward and defends. They were 206 for 5 staring at a win and what a turn around from there
Beaten again. Another one that angles away from Langeveldt who pushes at it, bat meets air, ball heads to Sangakkara. Malinga to bowl the next over.
Swing and a miss. What a cracking game this has been. Full and just outside off stump, slants away, he has a drive, but inside the line and the ball rushes past the outside edge.

Peterson does it for SA with a edge past the slip. Fullish, outside off stump, Peterson drives, gets a outside edge and it runs down to third man boundary. SA have won. They nearly choked but have pulled it off. Peterson jumps in the air, pumps his fist and then smashes the stumps down at the other end. Immediately apologises! What a cracker of a game!
